attributes.action: Stop charging Nurses an annual registration fee
attributes.additional_details: I was astonished to hear Nurses have to pay £120 a year to be registered to look after people. Surely once passsing exams this would make them qualified. I am not aware of any other proffesion having to do this, a Mechanic doesn't pay an annual fee so they can repair vehicles, MPs dont pay an annual fee to sit in Parliment, no they actually get attendance bonuses. With this outbreak of COVID19 we are seeing nurses have put themselves at risk without the incorrect PPE caring for patients.
attributes.background: The Goverment needs to waive the £120 fee a Nurse needs to pay to be registered to look after people.

rejection.details:
The level of registrations fees are a matter for independent regulators such as the General Medical Council and Nursing and Midwifery Council, and not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to reimburse health care professionals for professional registration fees, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307399

You could start a new petition calling on the Government to fund health regulators directly, so they do not need to charge a registration fee.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
